      An implementation of adaptive large neighborhood search algorithm.

      Destroyer of a valid solution agent into a partial solution.

      An implementation of neighborhood search optimization process.
      interface  Optimizer<A extends Agent>
      Optimizer based on neighborhood search.
      interface  Repairer<T,​A extends Agent>
      Repairer of partially destroyed solution to build a valid solution agent.

      Checks if the new neighbor solution agent is acceptable compared to current one.

    • Uses of Agent in org.optim4j.ns.acceptancecriteria

      Methods in org.optim4j.ns.acceptancecriteria with parameters of type Agent 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean GreedyAcceptanceCriteria.isAcceptable​(Agent current, Agent neighbor)
      Accepts if the neighbor has better fitness value than current agent.
      boolean OldBachelorAcceptanceCriteria.isAcceptable​(Agent current, Agent neighbor)
      Accepts the neighbor agent if it has better fitness than the current agent or the fitness difference is lesser than or equal to current threshold.
      boolean RandomWalkAcceptanceCriteria.isAcceptable​(Agent current, Agent neighbor)
      Accepts all solutions irrespective of their fitness value.
      boolean SimulatedAnnealingAcceptanceCriteria.isAcceptable​(Agent current, Agent neighbor)
      Accepts the neighbor agent if it has better fitness than current agent.
      boolean ThresholdAcceptanceCriteria.isAcceptable​(Agent current, Agent neighbor)
      Accepts the neighbor agent if it has better fitness than the current agent or the fitness difference is lesser than or equal to threshold.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean UnchangedBestFitness.isComplete​(Agent agent)
      Checks if the maximum no of generations is passed since we get the last best fitness.
